Welcome to NNGUI’s documentation!¶

Here are some main module functions

class main.Browser(dir_sel, tag, exts)¶

Browser window superclass describing directory/folder selector Don’t use it separately, only for inheritance!

class main.CSVBrowser(tag_child)¶

Browser class for selecting CSV file

class main.DatasetBrowser(datatype)¶

Browser class for selecting dataset directory

class main.ImageBrowser(tag_child)¶

Browser class for selecting single image

class main.ModelBrowser(tag_child)¶

Browser class for selecting model file

main.build_csv()¶

callback function, builds table from chosen csv file

main.change_step(_, x)¶

callback, changes number of strings to display :param _: sender, unnecessary :param x: value

main.check_dataset()¶

callback function that ckecks whether your datasets directories were chosen correctly (see output tab)

main.check_model()¶

callback function that shows the model architecture

main.csv_surfer(_, x)¶

callback, displays (csv_step) rows, starting from (csv_index_cnt) :param _: sender, unnecessary :param x: csv_index_cnt value

main.data_prepairing()¶

Callback for DatasetBrowser class, creates dataloader objects after the train & test directories are chosen

main.fit()¶

callback function that starts model training, see the output tab for some logs

main.gui()¶

app markup

main.gui_init()¶

app build function

main.predict()¶

callback function for single image prediction, see the output tab for the result

Here are some functions from module with classifying NN

class nntemplate.TrainSet(dir)¶

Class containing train dataset

__init__(dir)¶

Trainset class constructor :param dir: path to trainset directory

__len__()¶

get length of trainset :return: length

class nntemplate.ValSet(dir1, dir2)¶

Chunga changa

__init__(dir1, dir2)¶

ValSet class constructor :param dir: path to trainset directory

__len__()¶

get length of set :return: length

nntemplate.fit(epochs, lr, train_dl, valid_dl)¶

fit the NN :param epochs: amount of epochs :param lr: learning rate :param train_dl: dataloader for train :param valid_dl: dataloader for validation :return: validation accuracy, validation loss, train accuracy

nntemplate.get_key(d, value)¶

Gets value from dict by key

nntemplate.loss_batch(model, xb, yb, opt=None)¶

get loss value among batch :param model: model :param xb: predicts :param yb: labels :param opt: optimizer :return: loss

nntemplate.predict(img_path)¶

Makes predict
